docs.snippet: Liberal judge Rebecca Dallet cruised to victory in race to serve on the Wisconsin Supreme Court for a 10-year term, the Associated Press reported late on Tuesday.

headline.main: Liberal Judge Rebecca Dallet Wins Wisconsin Supreme Court Race: AP
headline.print_headline: Liberal Judge Rebecca Dallet Wins Wisconsin Supreme Court Race: AP

docs.snippet: The United States plans additional responses to Russian activities that will include a number of steps to defend November congressional elections against meddling from Moscow, the top U.S. intelligence chief said on Wednesday.

headline.main: U.S. Plans More Responses to Malign Russian Activities: Coats
headline.print_headline: U.S. Plans More Responses to Malign Russian Activities: Coats

docs.snippet: Mexico's interior minister said on Monday that he spoke to the U.S. homeland security secretary Kirstjen Nielsen, agreeing to work together to study how to best address the flow of migrants.

headline.main: Mexican Government Says Discussed Migrants With U.S. Homeland Security Secretary
headline.print_headline: Mexican Government Says Discussed Migrants With U.S. Homeland Security Secretary

docs.snippet: The White House said on Wednesday it hoped China would change its "unfair trade practices" in a way that would avoid the need for the Trump administration to move forward with announced import tariffs.

headline.main: White House Says Hopes China Changes Trade Practices to Avert Tariffs
headline.print_headline: White House Says Hopes China Changes Trade Practices to Avert Tariffs

docs.snippet: Migrants in a caravan that drew criticism from U.S. President Donald Trump began packing up their meager possessions and boarding buses to Mexico City and the nearby city of Puebla on Thursday.

headline.main: Migrants Leave Caravan Camp in Southern Mexico
headline.print_headline: Migrants Leave Caravan Camp in Southern Mexico

docs.snippet: Following attacks by President Donald Trump on Amazon.com Inc, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce criticized attacks by government officials against American companies.

headline.main: After Attacks on Amazon, U.S. Chamber Criticizes Targeting American Business
headline.print_headline: After Attacks on Amazon, U.S. Chamber Criticizes Targeting American Business

docs.snippet: Migrants forming a caravan in southern Mexico are subject to an administrative migratory procedure, the Mexican foreign ministry said on Monday, after the caravan drew the ire of U.S. President Donald Trump.

headline.main: Mexico Says Migrants in Caravan Face Administrative Procedure
headline.print_headline: Mexico Says Migrants in Caravan Face Administrative Procedure

docs.snippet: South Korea said on Friday it has notified the World Trade Organization (WTO) that it seeks to suspend tariff concessions on imported U.S. goods worth $480 million, in response to U.S. measures against South Korean imports.

headline.main: South Korea Notifies WTO of Plans to Suspend Tariff Concessions on U.S. Goods
headline.print_headline: South Korea Notifies WTO of Plans to Suspend Tariff Concessions on U.S. Goods

docs.snippet: The Trump administration signed off Thursday on selling more than $1.3 billion in artillery to Saudi Arabia, giving a vote of confidence to the Saudi military as young Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman concludes a marathon tour of the United States...

headline.main: US Approves $1.3 Billion Sale of Artillery to Saudi Arabia
headline.print_headline: US Approves $1.3 Billion Sale of Artillery to Saudi Arabia

docs.snippet: Central American migrants stranded on a journey through Mexico because of U.S. President Donald Trump's pressure on the Mexican government say they will struggle on toward the United States, even as their "caravan" said it would disband in Mexico ...

headline.main: Central American 'Caravan' to End in Mexico City, Migrants Defiant
headline.print_headline: Central American 'Caravan' to End in Mexico City, Migrants Defiant
